axes.axis: Dangerous object left in patient’s body
axes.measure_details: Foreign Object Retained This number represents the number of times dangerous objects were left inside patients for every 1000 people discharged.

axes.axis: Air or gas bubble in the blood
axes.measure_details: Air Embolism This number represents the number of times patients had an air or gas bubble in the blood for every 1,000 people discharged.
Pressure Ulcer--Stages 3 and 4 This number represents the number of times patients experienced dangerous bed sores for every 1,000 people discharged.
Falls and Trauma This number represents the number of times patients experienced falls for every 1,000 people discharged.

axes.axis: Infection in the blood during ICU stay
axes.measure_details: CLABSI This number represents a comparison of the number of infections in the blood that actually happened at this hospital to the number of infections expected for this hospital, given the types of patients they care for. A number lower than one means fewer infections than expected; a number more than one means more infections than expected.

axes.axis: Infection in the urinary tract during ICU stay
axes.measure_details: CAUTI This number represents a comparison of the number of infections in the urinary tract that actually happened at this hospital to the number of infections expected for this hospital, given the types of patients they care for. A number lower than one means fewer infections than expected; a number more than one means more infections than expected.

axes.axis: Surgical site infection after colon surgery
axes.measure_details: SSI: Colon This number represents a comparison of the number of infections after colon surgery that actually happened at this hospital to the number of infections expected for this hospital, given the types of patients they care for. A number lower than one means fewer infections than expected; a number more than one means more infections than expected.
PSI 4: Death Among Surgical Inpatients This number represents the estimated number of patients that died for every 1,000 people who had a serious treatable complication.
PSI 6: Iatrogenic Pneumothorax This number represents the estimated number of times patients experienced collapsed lungs for every 1,000 people discharged.
PSI 11: Postoperative Respiratory Failure This number represents the estimated number of times patients experienced serious breathing problems for every 1,000 people who had surgery.
PSI 12: Postoperative PE/DVT This number represents the estimated number of times patients experienced dangerous blood clots for every 1,000 people who had a procedure in the operating room.
PSI 14: Postoperative Wound Dehiscence This number represents the estimated number of times surgical wounds split open for every 1,000 people who had surgery on their abdomen.
PSI 15: Accidental Puncture or Laceration This number represents the estimated number of times patients experienced accidental cuts and tears during a procedure for every 1,000 people discharged.

axes.axis: Doctors order medications through a computer
axes.measure_details: Computerized Physician Order Entry (CPOE) Hospitals can earn up to 100 points for having a well-functioning CPOE system in most areas of the hospital.

axes.axis: Specially trained doctors care for ICU patients
axes.measure_details: ICU Physician Staffing (IPS) Hospitals can earn up to 100 points for staffing their ICUs with intensivists.
Safe Practice 1: Leadership Structures and Systems Hospitals can earn up to 120 points for effective leaders.

axes.axis: Staff work together to prevent errors
axes.measure_details: Safe Practice 2: Culture Measurement, Feedback & Intervention Hospitals can earn up to 20 points for working together to prevent errors.
Safe Practice 3: Teamwork Training and Skill Building Hospitals can earn up to 40 points for the right training that improves safety.

axes.axis: Track and reduce risks to patients
axes.measure_details: Safe Practice 4: Identification and Mitigation of Risks and Hazards Hospitals can earn up to 120 points for tracking and reducing risks to patients.
Safe Practice 9: Nursing Workforce Hospitals can earn up to 100 points for having enough qualified nurses.
Safe Practice 17: Medication Reconciliation Hospitals can earn up to 35 points for correctly communicating a patient’s medications.
Safe Practice 19: Hand Hygiene Hospitals can earn up to 30 points for having a handwashing policy.

axes.axis: Take steps to prevent ventilator problems
axes.measure_details: Safe Practice 23: Care of the Ventilated Patient Hospitals can earn up to 20 points for taking steps to care for ventilated patients.

SCIP INF 1: Antibiotic within 1 Hour Hospitals can earn 100 points for using antibiotics right before surgery. A number close to 100 means that the hospital is doing well at using antibiotics right before surgery.

SCIP INF 2: Antibiotic Selection Hospitals can earn 100 points for using the correct antibiotics before surgery. A number close to 100 means that the hospital is doing well at using the correct antibiotics before surgery.

SCIP INF 3: Antibiotic Discontinued After 24 Hours Hospitals can earn 100 points for using the stopping antibiotics soon after surgery. A number close to 100 means that the hospital is doing well at stopping antibiotics soon after surgery.

SCIP INF 9: Catheter Removal Hospitals can earn 100 points for removing catheters soon after surgery. A number close to 100 means that the hospital is doing well at removing catheters soon after surgery.

axes.axis: Take steps to prevent blood clots
axes.measure_details: SCIP VTE 2: VTE Prophylaxis Hospitals can earn 100 points for taking the right steps to prevent blood clots. A number close to 100 means that the hospital is doing well at taking the right steps to prevent blood clots.
